caption:
b'When Suzy Macke shows up, it\xe2\x80\x99s because there\xe2\x80\x99s a problem. Being able to fix it, is the best part of her job. Macke is a lineworker in Cincinnati. She\xe2\x80\x99s a troubleman, which means she rides solo and is the first responder for most calls from customers. If she can fix it, power is restored faster because the customer won\xe2\x80\x99t have to wait for a larger crew to be dispatched and make repairs. Click the link in our bio to read more.
.
.
.
#thankalineman #lineworker #linelife #lineman #thankalineworker'

b"Our mission since bringing electricity to the Carolinas in 1904 has been to power the lives of our customers and the vitality of its communities. By 2050, we plan to achieve net-zero carbon emissions. It\xe2\x80\x99s ambitious, but we're well on our way. Click the link in our bio to learn more.
.
.
.
#esg #innovation #renewable #renewableenergy #futureofenergy #energystorage #hydro #ev"

b'Marshall Hydroelectric Station is the perfect backdrop for fall. Nestled on the French Broad River in North Carolina, the station began operations in 1910. Quick start-up times make hydroelectric power ideal for providing electricity in a matter of seconds when demand is high. :maple_leaf:
.
.
.
#hydropower #renewableenergy #hydroelectricity #frenchbroadriver #hydro #fall'

b'From the littlest electrical switches to rotors that weigh 300 tons, we recently completed a multi-year renovation at Cowans Ford Hydroelectric Station to update nearly every part of the plant. Cowans Ford, built in 1963, is the company\xe2\x80\x99s largest conventional hydroelectric plant. Located on Lake Norman, north of Charlotte, N.C., it can produce more than 320 megawatts of renewable, carbon-free energy in minutes \xe2\x80\x93 which means it can provide power quickly when demand peaks on hot summer afternoons and cold winter mornings. Click the link in our bio for more.
.
.
.
#cleanenergy #renewables #hydro #renewableenergy #hydroelectric #waterpower'

b'With a souped-up fish finder and an airboat, Brett and Eryn spend the summer on the Catawba and Wateree rivers looking for plants that could cause problems. They\xe2\x80\x99re scientists for our aquatic plant management program, and the sooner they find plants that could crowd waterways, the better it is for those who depend on the water. Click the link in our bio to learn more.
.
.
.
#aquaticplants #behindthescience #airboat #invasivespecies'

b'Join aquatic plant scientists Brett and Eryn as they take over our Instagram account to hunt for invasive plant species. Stay tuned for a behind-the-scenes look at how they protect our waterways.
.
.
.
#aquaticplants #behindthescience #airboat #invasivespecies'

b'We\xe2\x80\x99re celebrating #AmericanWindWeek by showcasing some of our teammates and their amazing views from across the country. For over a decade, we\xe2\x80\x99ve proudly provided wind energy solutions to businesses, developers and small utilities.
.
.
.
#windenergy #windtech #windturbine #renewableenergy #renewables'

b'Behind the orange groves that line U.S. Highway 27 in Frostproof, Fla., a Nucor Steel construction crew is building a first-of-its-kind steel mill for the state. To get transmission lines to the plant, we used helicopters, which was faster and reduced disruptions caused by construction. To build the line, crews still set the bases of the poles like normal, but they were able to skip the time-consuming task of pulling the line from pole to pole. The helicopter pilot attaches a lightweight rope to the aircraft and pulls it from a large spool to each pole where the rope is snapped into a roller attached to the pole. The 2 1/2-mile section of line took one day to complete with helicopters rather than the days or weeks it could have taken a crew. Click the link in our bio to learn more.
.
.
.
@nucorcorporation #helicopter #innovation #thankalineman #linelife #transmission #aviation #lineworker #nucor #nucorproud'

b'The issues facing bats are complex, but these critters are crucial to the ecosystem. Bats are small, they migrate and fly at night, so it\xe2\x80\x99s difficult to learn how many are out there. Some species are struggling with the deadly White Nose Syndrome, while many others face habitat loss, pesticides and the challenges associated with climate change. Wind energy is an additional hurdle. That\xe2\x80\x99s why we\xe2\x80\x99re using new technology to help keep these pollinators safe. The Bat Deterrent System, an ultrasonic acoustic device developed by NRG Systems, reduced overall bat fatalities by 50 percent with reductions of nearly 80 percent in some species. A study published in May found the technology so successful, that we\xe2\x80\x99ve equipped 255 wind turbines at Los Vientos with the device. It will be the first commercial-scale installation in the continental United States. Click the link in our bio to learn more.
.
.
.
#pollinators #renewableenergy #bat #newtech #windturbine #windpower'

b'Last week @northcarolinaports made history, welcoming the largest ship to ever enter the Port of Wilmington. We\xe2\x80\x99re proud to be part of this collaborative effort with local leaders and our crews who raised the transmission line over the Cape Fear River. See what it took to de-energize, climb and raise the lines as massive cranes made their way to the port.
.
.
.
#thankalineman #linelife #ncports #PortofWilmington #containershipping #ports #maritime #containership #lineworker'

b'What does a high school student do when his bull riding career runs out? Become a lineworker. At 19, after a childhood spent in rodeos, Josh Watson decided to follow in the footsteps of his father and grandfather who each served more than 30 years as lineworkers. Watson is based in Kernersville, N.C., just east of Winston-Salem, where his crew works on everything from overhead to underground lines. Earlier this year we followed Josh Watson to see what a typical day for a lineworker might be. Every day is different\xe2\x80\x93 and that\xe2\x80\x99s one of the things he loves about the job. Click the link in our bio to learn more.
.
.
.
#thankalineman #linelife #thankalineworker #lineman #lineworker'

b'Since 2013 we\xe2\x80\x99ve celebrated National Lineman Appreciation Day on April 18 to thank lineworkers for their tireless hard work and commitment to our customers. A lot has changed this year, but one thing that hasn\xe2\x80\x99t is their dedication to keeping the lights on for our customers. Join us this Saturday to help thank our lineworkers and other front line responders by turning on your front lights at 9 p.m. #thankalineman
.
.
.
#thankalineman #nationallinemanappreciationday #nlad #lineworker #linework #lineman #linemen #linemanappreciationday  #nationallineworkerappreciationday #thankalineworker #wearede'

b'Since 2013 we\xe2\x80\x99ve celebrated National Lineman Appreciation Day on April 18 to thank lineworkers for their tireless hard work and commitment to our customers. A lot has changed this year, but one thing that hasn\xe2\x80\x99t is their dedication to keeping the lights on for our customers. Join us this Saturday to help thank our lineworkers and other front line responders by turning on your front lights at 9 p.m. #thankalineman
.
.
.
#thankalineman #nationallinemanappreciationday #nlad #lineworker #linework #lineman #linemen #linemanappreciationday  #nationallineworkerappreciationday #thankalineworker #wearede'

b'Meet Chipo Mkandla. When she moved to the United States from Zimbabwe to work in hospitality, she never imagined she\xe2\x80\x99d end up at an energy company. It turns out the roles had more in common than she thought. Mkandla is part of Duke Energy\xe2\x80\x99s customer experience team, and her job is to study the interactions between customers and the company and see if she can find ways to improve them. For her, the most rewarding part is the company can measure the improvement in the customers\xe2\x80\x99 experiences. \xe2\x80\x9cWith technology and new innovations, customers are expecting more from us. We\xe2\x80\x99re looking at what technology we can use, what software is out there and how we can get ahead of it so we can be sure we\xe2\x80\x99re providing services that are valuable for our customers,\xe2\x80\x9d said Mkandla.
.
.
.
#WomensHistoryMonth #femaleleadership #data #technology #weareDE #womeninenergy'

b"Women make up about 20 percent of the country\xe2\x80\x99s utility industry workforce, and we're on a mission to change that. We\xe2\x80\x99ve powered the lives of our customers for more than a century. From charging your cell phone to running a business, electricity is at the foundation of everything we do. Our purpose hasn\xe2\x80\x99t changed, but as the industry evolves and we find new ways to generate cleaner energy and provide the products and services that customers ask for, we\xe2\x80\x99ll be stronger if our workforce reflects the communities we serve. For #WomensHistoryMonth, meet a few employees who want other women to know that they can find fulfilling careers in the energy industry from engineering to customer service, maintenance and more. These women excel in their roles while encouraging the next generation.
.
.
.
#WHM #engineer #nuclear #tech #womeninenergy #STEM #STEMgirls #technology"

b"We've installed our one millionth solar panel in Florida this month while putting the finishing touches on the Columbia Solar Power Plant. The site, in Fort White, Fla. about 45 minutes north of Gainesville, is the latest in the our effort to bring 700 megawatts of solar to the state by 2022 and 1,500 megawatts by 2028. By mid-2020, enough solar will have been installed in Florida to eliminate 1.5 billion pounds of carbon dioxide emissions annually.
.
.
.
#solar #renewableenergy #solarpanel #renewable #energy"

b'From a six-year-old with a science kit to #smartgrid engineer, Aleksandar Vukojevic is building the blueprint for the grid of the future. His passion for experimentation and education has earned him more than a dozen patents, two bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degrees, a master\xe2\x80\x99s degree in electrical engineering from @GeorgiaTech, and an MBA from @GeorgiaStateUniversity. Why so many degrees? The same reason he became interested in engineering: his father, who instilled in him the value of education.\n\nThere are many kinds of #engineers \xe2\x80\x93 mechanical, civil, electrical, nuclear, chemical \xe2\x80\x93 but all of them have one thing in common: they love to solve problems and find ways to make things better. You can find just about any kind of engineer at Duke Energy working in the field, a power plant or the corporate office. To learn more about our engineers and celebrate #EWeek2020, click the link in our bio.'

b'After years of hiking deep into the @GreatSmokyNPS to service a park ranger communications tower, one lineman decided to shake things up. Technology is advancing, so why not bring some of that innovation into the woods? His idea, remove the power lines that serve the tower, and replace them with a #microgrid. This idea became a reality and we were able to return 13 acres of land back to the park.
.
.
.
#solar #renewableenergy #nationalpark #greatsmokymountains #thankalineman'

b'Meet Tim Hayes. He spends a lot of time looking at the ground. That might seem like an odd approach to interpret the world, but it\xe2\x80\x99s the way of a wildlife biologist.  Eyes pointed just beyond his feet, he looks for tufts of fur, tracks in the sand, and even bits of poop because these are clues as to what wildlife lives near Duke Energy Renewables\xe2\x80\x99 solar and wind sites. Every detail, he said, is a piece of the puzzle that provides a picture of the ecosystem and its health. \xe2\x80\x9cFor my whole career, I have been able to leverage the power of industry to be able to do good things for conservation,\xe2\x80\x9d Hayes said, \xe2\x80\x9cand it\xe2\x80\x99s one of the most rewarding parts of this job.\xe2\x80\x9d Learn more about Tim and his conservation work by clicking the link in our  bio.
.
.
.
#renewableenergy #conservation #windpower #windturbine #renewables #biologist #wildlife #wildlifebiologist'

b'Tune in later this week as wildlife biologist Tim Hayes, takes over our Instagram account to share a behind-the-scenes look at his work in the field.
.
.
.
#renewableenergy #wildlifebiologist #biologist'

b'Located in Colorado, our Kit Carson wind facility generates enough electricity to power approximately 15,000 homes. The 34-turbine site began commercial operation in 2010.
.
.
.
#windpower #renewableenergy #windturbine #windfarm #turbine #renewables'

b'After years of hiking deep into the @GreatSmokyNPS to service a park ranger communications tower, one lineman decided to shake things up. Technology is advancing, so why not bring some of that innovation into the woods? His idea, remove the power lines that serve the tower, and replace them with a #microgrid. This idea became a reality and we were able to return 13 acres of land back to the park.
.
.
.
#solar #renewableenergy #nationalpark #greatsmokymountains #thankalineman'

b'After 125 years, holiday traditions carry on at @BiltmoreEstate in Asheville, N.C. It\xe2\x80\x99s hard to imagine that the Biltmore House could be grander, but every holiday season, the team finds a way to make it so. This year, the home and its grounds are covered in almost 200,000 twinkling lights and more than 100 trees. Click the link in our bio to learn more.
.
.
.
#holidaylights #deckthehalls #biltmore #christmasatbiltmore'

b'Meet Sean Grier, a renewables engineer and @usarmy veteran. Grier came to the company after serving eight years, including tours in Saudi Arabia during Desert Storm and later in Iraq. His commitment to preparation and determination not only serves him well in his role, but it has evolved into mentoring and supporting young engineers on his team. \xe2\x80\x9cWe\xe2\x80\x99re all enrolled in master\xe2\x80\x99s programs because he pushed us to do it,\xe2\x80\x9d said engineer Caleb Fisher, who came to work for Grier in 2018. Today we honor veterans not only for their service, but also for what they bring to post-military careers. #VeteransDay'

b'Located on the Pigeon River near the North Carolina and Tennessee border, you\xe2\x80\x99ll find our Walters Hydroelectric Plant. Opened in 1930, the plant uses an arch-shaped dam, 180 feet tall and 870 feet long, to produce 112 megawatts. In 1980, Walters was designated a N.C. historic civil engineering landmark for its unique and pioneering design. Every year more than 130,000 people use the scheduled water release from the plant for white water rafting and kayaking. :maple_leaf::fallen_leaf::water_wave:
.
.
.
#hydroenergy #greatsmokymountains #hydropower #hydroelectric'

b'As lineworkers battled their way through the Puerto Rican jungle to help restore power after Hurricane Maria, three employees revolutionized storm response using drones and a 3D printed magnetic release device to re-string power lines. In 2018, lineworkers scoured the island for broken poles and downed power lines that, in some places, were buried under five months\xe2\x80\x99 worth of overgrown vegetation after Hurricane Maria left the electrical system in pieces. Drones were called in to assist with identifying the buried infrastructure, but the team did so much more than that.
.
.
.
#drones #uav #dronesforgood #3Dprinted #instadrone #hurricanemaria #droneweek'

b'Tune in tomorrow as distribution engineer Kendall Blaine takes over our Instagram account to share a behind-the-scenes look at her day in the field.
.
.
.
#engineer #powerdelivery #energy'

b'This weekend over 70 of our lineworkers competed with the best in the world at the International Lineman\xe2\x80\x99s Rodeo. The conditions were rough, but for lineworkers conditions are rarely perfect and they don\xe2\x80\x99t quit when things get tough. They brought home a total of six awards, including the World\xe2\x80\x99s Best Senior Team. Congratulations to all of our winners and competitors!
.
.
.
#internationalrodeokc #thankalineman #lineworker #linelife #worldsbest'

b"We're breaking down what happens at the International Lineman's Rodeo. Next event, the hurt-man rescue. Learn more about the rodeo and our competing lineworkers by clicking the link in our bio.
.
.
.
#thankalineman #lineworker #linelife #linemanrodeo2019"

b"Linework is a career unlike any other, so it makes sense that the preparation is unusual, too. Every year since 1984, lineworkers from around the world have gathered in Bonner Springs, Kan., to compete in the International Lineman\xe2\x80\x99s Rodeo. What happens at a lineman's rodeo? Don't worry, we'll break it down for you. First event, the Speed Climb.
.
.
.
#thankalineman #lineworker #linemanrodeo2019"

b'When Dr. Gill Wylie, James B. Duke and William States Lee decided to electrify the Carolinas in the early 1900s, they started with hydropower. That included the Wateree Hydro Station, take a look at this historic plant as it celebrates its 100 year anniversary. Click the link in our bio to learn more. :water_wave:
.
.
.
#hydropower #renewableenergy #hydrostation #renewables'

b'Me to my co-workers: what\xe2\x80\x99s the craziest thing you\xe2\x80\x99ve seen on the job?

Them: :helicopter:
.
.
.
Click the link in our bio to learn more. #aerialsaw #md500 #transmission #treetrimming'

b'We had more than 9,000 crews from 23 states and Canada ready to respond to Hurricane Dorian\xe2\x80\x99s unexpected path. The crews, which included line workers, damage assessors, tree specialists and other support personnel, restored more than 288,000 outages in the North Carolina alone in the three days following the storm. While the brunt of Hurricane #Dorian\xe2\x80\x99s damage was outside of our service area, our storm response team was prepared for the worst. Meet some of the lineworkers who restored power after the storm. Thank you to all our crews for their work and to our customers for their patience.
.
.
.
#thankalineman #lineworker #hurricanerestoration #mutualaid'

b'More than 120 years ago, Dr. Gill Wylie had an idea that would change the Carolinas forever. Inspired by electrification efforts at Niagara Falls, he wanted to harness the power of the Catawba River to provide electricity to support the manufacturing industry near his hometown, Chester, S.C.

He built Old Catawba Hydroelectric Station, which included a rope-driven water wheel, and electrified nearby mills near Fort Mill, S.C. Not long after, he partnered with financier James Buchanan Duke and engineer William States Lee to start Duke Energy\xe2\x80\x99s predecessor, Southern Power Company, with Great Falls Hydroelectric Station.
.
.
.
#hydroday #hydropower #renewableenergy #hydroenergy'

b"Here's a look at the construction work that went into building our Bad Creek Hydroelectric Station in 1985.

Located in Oconee County, S.C., the pumped-storage station uses a two reservois system to generate electricity. Current upgrades are underway, and once completed the station will be able to produce as much energy as some nuclear plants and power more than 1 million homes.
.
.
. 
#hydroenergy #pumpedstorage #hydropower #tbt"

b'David Horinek and his son, Tanner, carry on a tradition of farming land in Newkirk, Okla., that\xe2\x80\x99s been in his family for more than 100 years. But farming comes with financial challenges, and to preserve their farm for the next generation, Horinek is making his land available to Duke Energy Renewables for #windturbines.

Spreading out newspaper articles about his great grandfather and grandfather on the dining room table he built 27 years ago, Horinek talks about what he owes his family. \xe2\x80\x9cThey worked really hard to keep our land together so it could be passed down from generation to generation. Their work provided my dad Fred and I the opportunity to expand and continue farming.\xe2\x80\x9d His turbines are part of Frontier Windpower, Duke Energy Renewables\xe2\x80\x99 first wind project in Oklahoma.

Tanner, 23, plans to get married later this year and carry on the family tradition of farming in Newkirk. The wind turbines provide a nice nest egg, and more importantly, confidence that the farm with have the Horinek name for another 100 years. Click the link in our bio to read more.
.
.
.
#windpower #windfarm #renewableenergy #windturbine #americanwindweek'

b"We're expanding our Frontier Windpower project in Oklahoma, making it the largest wind power project in our fleet. Once complete Frontier I and II will generate a total of 550 MW of wind energy \xe2\x80\x93 enough to power approximately 193,000 homes.
.
.
.
#windenergy #windpower #renewables #windturbine"

b'Meet Jericho. He helps keep trees off power lines. It can be hard to tell the difference between a healthy tree and one that\xe2\x80\x99s not doing so well, but he knows what to look for. Trees and other plants are a leading cause of power outages, so his job is to find the trees that could cause trouble. Sometimes the trees must be removed while others are pruned to comply with federal regulations for power transmission. It can be a contentious topic because people love trees \xe2\x80\x93 they provide environmental benefits and natural beauty \xe2\x80\x93 but Belcher\xe2\x80\x99s mission is to leave as many trees as possible and address customers\xe2\x80\x99 concerns while meeting his obligation to provide safe and reliable electricity. Click the link in our bio to learn more.
.
.
.
#vegetation #arborist #arblife'

b'Tune in Monday as vegetation specialist Jericho Belcher takes over our Instagram account to share a behind-the-scenes look at how he helps to protect the grid. Follow along on our stories!
.
.
.
#vegetation #arborist #arblife'

b'Some of the oldest trees in the world are rooted along the swampy twists and turns of the Black River in eastern North Carolina. When @uarkansas researcher David Stahle first saw the #baldcypress trees in the 1980s, he knew they were ancient, but he recently proved that one is at least 2,624 years old \xe2\x80\x93 making it the fifth oldest living tree in the world. Only eight species of trees have been proven to live for more than 2,000 years: six are in the western United States, one in Chile and now North Carolina. @Nature_org  has protected more than 18,000 acres along the Black River and recently purchased 319 acres of old growth forest there. Click the link in our bio to learn more.
.
.
.
#oldtrees #natureconservancy #forest #baldcypresstrees'

b'Did you know? Wind turbines can be as tall as a 50-story building. A single wind turbine blade is over 120 ft. long and weighs about 12,000 lbs.
.
.
.
#renewableenergy #windpower #renewable #windturbine'

b'Built in 1925, the Rhodhiss Hydro Station generated electricity for North Carolina textile mills in the early part of the 20th century and is still going strong today, almost 100 years later. One of three stations constructed in the mid-1920s, it was built to meet a commitment by James B. Duke, to provide #electricity to support the area\xe2\x80\x99s rapidly expanding textile industry. Because Rhodhiss Hydro Station retains its original function and much of its original equipment, and it played a significant role in the development of the region, the dam and powerhouse are eligible for listing in the National Register of Historic Places. :water_wave:
.
.
.
#renewableenergy #hydropower #hydroelectric #NRHP @nationalregisternps'
b'Our Blue Wing #solar facility, located in Texas, has more than 200,000 solar panels and generates enough #renewable energy to power about 2,800 households.'

b'Another beautiful sunrise at the Los Vientos wind farm in Willacy County, Texas. At full capacity this picture perfect wind farm generates enough electricity to power about 60,000 homes.
.
.
.
#renewableenergy #windpower #windturbine'

b'Our 100-year-old Buck Steam Station is featured in a @Smithsonian_channel show that highlights its glory days and its explosive demise. For nearly a century, the station harnessed the energy of coal and steam to provide power to 15 million homes and factories. The plant \xe2\x80\x93 and others like it \xe2\x80\x93 are coming down to make way for cleaner, more efficient energy sources. Click the link in our bio to learn more about the show.
.
.
.
#implosion #powergeneration #smithsonian'

b'This month our Bridgewater Hydro Station celebrates its 100th anniversary of supplying power to the N.C. foothills. To put that in perspective, the station began delivering power one month before Congress granted women the right to vote. Both events resulted in dramatic change. The amendment gave women full participation in society and the power plant brought economic progress to the rural Carolinas. 
Bridgewater was part of a larger project in the early 1900s to build a series of dams and powerhouses along the Catawba River in North Carolina and South Carolina to supply electricity to the textile mill industry and surrounding towns. Click the link in our bio to read more. .
.
.
#hydropower #renewableenergy #hydrostation #lakejames #catawba'

b"We've teamed up with @Siemens on a new combustion turbine. It has been designed to last longer and be the most efficient of its type in our fleet. The unit\xe2\x80\x99s engine, generator and main components weigh about four times more than a space shuttle and would snuggly fit inside an Olympic swimming pool. Some components are thinner than a sheet of paper, and others are made with lasers and robots. 
As part of an innovative agreement, Siemens will build and test its newest natural gas combustion turbine technology, the SGT6-9000HL, at our Lincoln Combustion Turbine Station in North Carolina.
.
.
.
#turbine #Siemens #innovation  @Siemens_USA"

b'Before starting yard work this spring, remember to #call811 to have underground power or gas lines marked before you dig. Calling 811 is an easy and free service. It\xe2\x80\x99s a good idea to call for every new project to stay safe. #DigSafe'

b'Earlier this week transmission lineman Tyler Coates took over our account. Today, for #NationalLinemanAppreciationDay, he is back to with another behind the scenes look of his high-voltage line crew. They climb and work on the tallest poles and towers on the grid \xe2\x80\x93 usually somewhere between 65 and 160 feet tall. Sometimes, though, the crew scales towers more than 300 feet tall. Those days are the best. \xe2\x80\x9cYou get to go home,\xe2\x80\x9d Coates said, \xe2\x80\x9cfeeling like you accomplished something.\xe2\x80\x9d Click the link in our bio to read more about Tyler and his crew.
.
.
.
#thankalineman #linelife #linework #lineman #lineworker #nlad'

b'Tune in next week as transmission lineman Tyler Coates takes over our Instagram account to share a behind-the-scenes look at linework leading up to National Lineman Appreciation Day. Follow along on our stories!
.
.
.
#thankalineman #transmission #linework #linelife'

b'From chasing storms to scaling poles, our lineworkers keep our lives running smoothly with reliable power. In addition to their daily work, lineworkers compete in rodeos that test job-related skills like climbing fast and making safe repairs. See how our lineworkers train to improve their craft and better serve our communities. .
.
.
#thankalineman #lineworker #linemanappreciation #linework'

b"When heavy rain threatens Carolina lakes, we're able to use an interconnected system that moves the water through generating turbines and floodgates to get the lakes back to normal. Our 32 hydro stations and reservoirs in the Carolinas are operated from one operations center, which is staffed around-the-clock to manage reservoirs along the Catawba-Wateree, Yadkin-Pee Dee, Keowee-Toxaway, Broad and Nantahala rivers. Hydropower plants are key to our mission of providing sustainable energy, and is a generation source we've been operating for over 100 years.
.
.
.
#hydropower #hydro #CatawbaRiver #hydrosystem #sustainability"

b"Did you miss our behind-the-scenes adventure with our wind technician? Don't worry. You can still catch it as a highlighted story on our profile! Click the 'Takeovers' highlight and follow Rene around for the day.
.
.
.
#windtech #renewableenergy #windpower"

b'Tune in next week as wind technician Rene Lopez takes over our Instagram account to share a behind-the-scenes look at our Los Vientos wind farm.
.
.
.
#renewableenergy #windtech #windfarm'

b'Yes. Girls can dig holes and set poles, just watch as 10-year-old Mia shadows #lineworker Ariel on the job. After just a year at Duke Energy, Ariel said she would\xe2\x80\x99ve considered linework sooner, but there are so few women in the profession that she didn\xe2\x80\x99t think it was an option. \xe2\x80\x9cThis was way outside the box for me, but someone told me about it, and I think I said, \xe2\x80\x98I wish I could do something like that,\xe2\x80\x99 and he said, \xe2\x80\x98why not?\xe2\x80\x99\xe2\x80\x9d That encouraged her to attend a four-month program where she learned to climb, make repairs and understand electrical systems. She came to Duke Energy in an entry-level #groundman position after graduating, and any doubts she had about fitting in or keeping up are gone. Click the link in our bio to learn more about Ariel and Mia\xe2\x80\x99s day together. #WomensHistoryMonth #WomeninEnergy'

b'Environmental Scientist Sherry Reid, who started her career at Duke Energy as a college student, was the perfect person to help sixth-grader Kiki see a career in STEM. Kiki spent the day with Sherry at our Environmental Offices for a one-of-a-kind tour not many get to experience. Duke Energy maintains and monitors more than 32,000 miles of power lines and dozens of waterways that are home to thousands of species of mammals, birds, reptiles, fish and insects. Reid is part of the team in North Carolina that protects those animals. For #WomensHistoryMonth, by showing girls careers they were unaware of, we hope to inspire them to cast aside gender roles and set their own path. Click the link in our bio to learn more. #WomenInPower'

b'It\xe2\x80\x99s important to make sure we\xe2\x80\x99re inspiring the next generation of female trailblazers. That\xe2\x80\x99s why for #InternationalWomensDay we\xe2\x80\x99re introducing you to Sharene, general manager of grid management, and eighth-grader Nina. Nina walked into our Distribution Control Center not sure what to expect, but Sharene was ready to give her a tour and advice. Click the link in our bio to read more about Nina\xe2\x80\x99s behind-the-scenes experience. #WomenInPower'

b'Built in 1910 by Southern Power, a predecessor of Duke Energy, Ninety-Nine Islands was the company\xe2\x80\x99s third hydroelectric plant and the first on the Broad River, fulfilling the company\xe2\x80\x99s goal of developing all of the waters of the Catawba River and its tributaries for electric power. More than a century later, the plant still provides clean, renewable power to the Carolinas\xe2\x80\x99 Piedmont region.
.
.
.
#hydropower #renewable #nrhp @nationalregisternps'

b"Earlier this year we completed our 74.9 megawatt Hamilton Solar Power Plant in Florida. The plant's carbon-free power is enough to energize more than 20,000 homes at peak production.
.
.
.
#solar #renewableenergy #renewables"

b'Watch as lineworkers, secured to a helicopter by rope, replace all 34 miles of this transmission line toppled by Hurricane Michael. Click the link in our bio to learn more.
.
.
.
#helicopter #thankalineman #hurricanemichael #linework'

b'Meet Rick Grant. He and his team of 750 problem solvers are working to keep storms from knocking out your power. Grant is the vice president of customer delivery engineering in the Carolinas. His team is made up of engineers, project managers, data analysts and GIS and engineering technicians who are designing the electric grid with the intent of preventing outages for more than 4 million customers in North and South Carolina. When asked about his job, Grant said, \xe2\x80\x9cI can\xe2\x80\x99t see myself doing anything differently \xe2\x80\x93 to be able to get folks back to where their lives are whole and get electricity restored \xe2\x80\x93 that has a certain satisfaction knowing we\xe2\x80\x99re doing some good in the world.\xe2\x80\x9d Click the link in our bio to read more.
.
.
.
#EWeek2019 #NationalEngineersWeek #engineer'

b'Meet Jeff Peet. He was always interested in construction but pursued engineering instead. When he was growing up in St. Petersburg, his dad would bring him to jobs at construction sites around Florida, and Peet was fascinated by the work. He loved building things like tree houses in the backyard and figuring out how things worked. Nearly 30 years after joining Duke Energy as an engineer, Jeff Peet finally reached his dream of working on a construction project. He\xe2\x80\x99s the lead project engineer on the Citrus Combined Cycle Station near Crystal River, Fla. Click to link in our bio to learn more. .
.
.
#EWeek2019 #NationalEngineersWeek #engineer'

b'Meet Tomas Mendez. He found a career he loves working on renewables. His job is to make sure the parts that make up wind and solar farms are working together. Sometimes, that means climbing to the top of turbines. Tomas says the climb is worth it, though, to feel the breeze blowing and see the Gulf of Mexico in the distance and the tiny cars below. \xe2\x80\x9cIt was,\xe2\x80\x9d he said, \xe2\x80\x9ca rush.\xe2\x80\x9d Click the link in our bio to learn more about Tomas.
.
.
.
#EWeek2019 #engineer #renewableenergy #windpower #NationalEngineersWeek'

b"Meet Christine Johnsen. She balances creativity and science as a nuclear engineer. She thought writing would be her career, but a high school chemistry class and the SAT changed her plans. Now she designs nuclear reactors and authors children's books. \xe2\x80\x9cThe moment when you get the core design approved, I think that\xe2\x80\x99s the most exciting thing,\xe2\x80\x9d Johnsen said. \xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s a lot of creativity, collaboration and teamwork, so when you hit that milestone, it feels, at least for us in core design, like we\xe2\x80\x99ve crossed a big race\xe2\x80\x99s finish line.\xe2\x80\x9d Click the link in our bio to read more.
.
.
.
#eweek #engineer #nuclearengineer"

b'There are many kinds of engineers \xe2\x80\x93 mechanical, civil, electrical, nuclear, chemical \xe2\x80\x93 but all of them have one thing in common: they love to solve problems and find ways to make things better. Next week we will introduce you to four of these problem solvers.
.
.
.
#eweek #engineer #engineerweek'

b'Take a look at our Florida Perry Solar Facility. Containing 22,000 solar panels, the facility is the size of 17 football fields and is producing five megawatts of carbon-free energy.
.
.

b'Watch helicopters replace massive transmission lines toppled by Hurricane Michael. The monstrous hurricane leveled more than 100 lattice-style transmission towers in a 34-mile right-of-way. The helicopters will allow the company to install 320 new steel poles faster and reach areas inaccessible by truck. Click the link in our bio to learn more.
.
.
.
#HurricaneMichael #helicopter #aviation'
b"Sunrise, sunset\xe2\x80\xa6no matter the time of day, as long as there's sunshine, we're producing clean, renewable #solarenergy for you."
b'Standing watch at the top of the world. These turbines rise above it all to generate #renewableenergy at our Top of the World wind farm in Converse County, Wy. #windpower'

b"We've heard of Sunday funday, but we're kicking off the week with a Monday sun day at our Blue Wing Solar Farm in San Antonio, Texas.

#solarpower #solar #renewableenergy"

b'Winter Storm Diego dumped a record amount of snow, sleet and ice across the Carolinas, pulling down trees and damaging poles. Nearly 700,000 customers were without power, and crews battled treacherous conditions to get the lights back on. Crews appreciate your patience and support as they continue to restore power in the hardest hit communities where we live and serve.
.
.
.
#thankalineman #Diego #WeAreDE'

b"We're always inspired by the colorful splendor of fall leaves, like these at our North Allegheny Wind Farm in Pennsylvania.

b'Clear, sunny skies are perfect for soaking up solar power, which is just what happens at our Bagdad, Ariz., solar farm.
.
.

#solarpower #renewableenergy #solar'

b'A team of engineers in a warehouse is tinkering with technology that will change the energy industry, batteries. On an 80-inch screen filled with charts and graphs, workers can swipe and tap to learn how energy output from the solar panels outside is interacting with batteries and, ultimately, how batteries will improve reliability and add more renewable energy to the grid. Click the link in our bio to learn more.
.
.
.
#batterystorage #technology #batteries #energy'

b"It's Monday\xe2\x80\xa6the sun's rising on a new week. Let's make the most of it.
.
.
.
#windpower #renewableenergy"

b'We are proud to have 2,200 veterans on staff, making up 8 percent of the workforce, and continue to recruit transitioning service members, guard and reservists. In observance of Veterans Day, meet Duke Energy employee and veteran Wayne Hambrick. 
Hambrick worked a couple of jobs after a back injury ended his career in the Marines. But he hadn\xe2\x80\x99t found what he was looking for \xe2\x80\x93 until he got a position working outside in sometimes difficult conditions with long hours. Hambrick joined Duke Energy in June as a groundperson, eventually deploying to Wilmington, N.C., to help with Hurricane Florence storm restoration. \xe2\x80\x9cFor the lineman side of (Duke Energy), it works like the military \xe2\x80\x93 just a little more relaxed,\xe2\x80\x9d he said. \xe2\x80\x9cEverybody is like, \xe2\x80\x98Let\xe2\x80\x99s go knock this out.\xe2\x80\x99\xe2\x80\x9d
.
.
.
#veteransday #thankalineman #thankaveteran'

b'Not far from our Charlotte, N.C., headquarters, a team of engineers in a warehouse is tinkering with technology that will change the energy industry. There are robots, solar panels and even machines that make water from air, but they are testing more familiar technology at the Mount Holly Innovation Lab, too: batteries. Batteries can not only store excess energy for when its needed, they can also control energy flow inside power lines, which results in fewer outages and flickers. As we prepare to install batteries on a larger scale, this thorough testing will be useful. Click the link in our bio to learn more.
.
.
.
#batterystorage #technology #batteries #energy'

b'On average, wind turbine towers are more than 280 feet tall. And sometimes, these towers can be as tall as nearly 500 feet! Talk about a high wind advisory. .
.
.
#windpower #renewableenergy'

b"Bats get an undeserved bad rap, in Tim Hayes\xe2\x80\x99 opinion. The Duke Energy biologist believes the sharp-toothed, pointy-eared creatures are some of the most misunderstood and useful animals on earth. \xe2\x80\x9cI can't think of another wildlife species that does more good things for people than bats,\xe2\x80\x9d he said. \xe2\x80\x9cOne benefit is they consume enormous amounts of insects, but they've got a bad image and most people think they\xe2\x80\x99re creepy. There\xe2\x80\x99s not another critter I can think of that provides more value to people.\xe2\x80\x9d Hayes has such a keen interest in bats that he spent months on a national committee charged with finding ways to prevent wind turbines from accidentally killing them. He\xe2\x80\x99s excited the wind energy industry recently adopted operating procedures his group proposed to curb the unintentional deaths.
.
.
.
#pollinators #windenergy #batappreciationmonth"

b'Since September, our customers have struggled with powerful, back-to-back hurricanes #Florence and #Michael. The storms devastated communities \xe2\x80\x93 flooding many and demolishing others. While crews are still hard at work, they appreciate your patience and support as they continue restoration and rebuilding efforts in the communities we live in and serve.
.
.
.
#hurricanemichael #hurricaneflorence #thankalineman'

b'Drew Caison is off and climbing. One of our favorite competitions is the Speed Climb. The goal is to climb the pole as quickly and safely as possible.

b'This is more than a competition. It helps us practice and sharpen our traditional climbing skills. The experience made all the difference when our guys were climbing in the jungles of Puerto Rico after Hurricane Maria, or more recently in the swamps of North Carolina after Florence.

b'The International Lineman\xe2\x80\x99s Rodeo brings the best lineworkers from around the world to compete in events based on traditional tasks and skills. First held in 1984, the Rodeo has grown to over 200 teams and 300 apprentice competitors.
.
.
.

b'Explore Bad Creek Hydro Station located more than 1,000 feet below the Bad Creek Reservoir, inside a South Carolina mountain. It uses the flow of water to create electricity, but its underground location and engineering help it store energy, too. It\xe2\x80\x99s essentially our largest battery. .
.
. 
#hydroenergy #pumpedstorage #engineering'

b'The sun has almost set on another week\xe2\x80\xa6 We hope your weekend is as awe-inspiring as watching the sun set at our Blue Wing Solar Farm in San Antonio, Texas.
.
.
.
 #solarenergy #renewableenergy #solarfarm'

b'Breylan and Bixley had a memorable first day of school thanks to a special friendship. They met Duke Energy lineman Joel Gore this summer, after they lost their dad - a fellow lineman who worked for another company. Gore, knowing how tight-knit the line worker community is, wanted to do special something for the both of them as they started a new school year. \xe2\x80\x9cI really believe that we are here for a purpose,\xe2\x80\x9d he said, \xe2\x80\x9cand I think God put me there to help him and his family. We are called to help our fellow neighbor.\xe2\x80\x9d Gore, a Distribution line technician, told his supervisor, about his idea for the convoy. He liked the idea, and so did many of Gore\xe2\x80\x99s fellow linemen at the Spartanburg Operations Center. So on Aug. 20, a convoy of eight Duke Energy trucks escorted Breylan and Bixley, for the first day of school. #thankalineman'
